meanings.definition: To put in a particular place or position.
meanings.sent1: She was emplacing the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was emplacing the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was emplacing its nuts in various hiding spots.
meanings.sent4: The artist was emplacing colors on the canvas with precision.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were emplacing themselves together perfectly.

meanings.definition: To establish or set up in a particular location.
meanings.sent1: The team was emplacing their tents for the night.
meanings.sent2: The company was emplacing a new office in the city.
meanings.sent3: The kids were emplacing their lemonade stand on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: The chef was emplacing a new dish on the menu.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was emplacing the equipment for the experiment.
